questiontext.text: From each of two normally distributed populations with equal variances a sample is drawn.______________. Sample 1: n = 13, mean = 58, sd = 11.05 Sample 2: n = 18, mean = 54, sd = 10.81. The pooled variance estimator takes the value 119.03. It is tested whether the population averages are equal. The corresponding test size follows, if the null hypothesis is TRUE,

answer.text: An F-distribution with 12 and 17 degrees of freedom

feedback.text: An F-distribution with 12 and 17 degrees of freedom: Incorrect

answer.text: A T distribution with 29 degrees of freedom

feedback.text: A T-division with 29 degrees of freedom: Correct

answer.text: A T distribution with 31 degrees of freedom

feedback.text: A T-division with 31 degrees of freedom: Incorrect

answer.text: An F-division with 13 and 18 degrees of freedom

feedback.text: An F-division with 13 and 18 degrees of freedom: Incorrect
